channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Motor bikes chained to lampposts, 5th September
item.description:
Since February this year three motor bikes have been chained to a lamppost outside my house. I reported to Peabody, who said you are responsible for the pathway. The owner has attempted to put petrol into the bikes, spilling it on the floor causing a fire risk. They are unsightly and an eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Resident has covered with a barrier to protect pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, High Street, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Trees Overgrowing Near Pedestrian Access, 5th September
item.description:
The trees on the east side of Elmstead Woods Drive, at the pedestrian crossing north of Grange Drive where it crosses Elmstead Lane, are obscuring the view of the road. As a result, pedestrians are forced to step into the carriageway before they can see vehicles approaching from Elmstead Lane. Please could these trees be trimmed back as a matter of urgency to restore visibility and improve safety?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised barriers to access northumberland place, 5th September
item.description:
Once AGAIN entry to northumberland place blocked both ends by barriers when signs clearly say access allowed. Please can WCC ensure residents are able to access their street as they are entitled. This has been reported over and over but it seems that the council is disregarding the rights of residents who pay council tax and for parking permits who are entitled to enter the street. Please permanently prevent this regularly occuring unauthorized obstruction to our rightful access.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Artesian Road, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request: Crown Reduction and Pruning of Tree on Montrave Road, 5th September
item.description:
This tree on Montrave Road (located between 9 St John’s Road and 11 St John’s Road) requires urgent attention. At present, the tree extends well above the height of the neighbouring properties, providing a route for squirrels to access rooftops and cause damage. Please could this be assigned to your tree contractor as a priority, with a significant crown reduction as well as crown thinning/pruning throughout the canopy. The works should ensure the tree remains suitably below the level of the neighbouring guttering (a minimum 1 metre but preferably more) thereby preventing squirrels from accessing the properties and causing further damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montrave Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
